description: A relatively new malware called Latrodectus is believed to be an evolution of the IcedID loader, seen in malicious email campaigns since November 2023. [...]
title: New Latrodectus malware replaces IcedID in network breaches

description: Visa is warning about a spike in detections for a new version of the JsOutProx malware targeting financial institutions and their customers. [...]
title: Visa warns of new JSOutProx malware variant targeting financial orgs

description: Microsoft has fixed an issue that triggers erroneous Outlook security alerts when opening .ICS calendar files after installing the December 2023 Outlook Desktop security updates [...]
title: Microsoft fixes Outlook security alerts bug caused by December updates

description: Hoya Corporation, one of the largest global manufacturers of optical products, says a "system failure" caused servers at some of its production plants and business divisions to go offline on Saturday. [...]
title: Hoyaâ€™s optics production and orders disrupted by cyberattack

description: Cancer treatment and research center City of Hope is warning that a data breach exposed the sensitive information of over 820,000 patients. [...]
title: US cancer center data breach exposes info of 827,000 patients

description: Newly discovered HTTP/2 protocol vulnerabilities called "CONTINUATION Flood" can lead to denial of service (DoS) attacks, crashing web servers with a single TCP connection in some implementations. [...]
title: New HTTP/2 DoS attack can crash web servers with a single connection

description: Recent high-profile malware attacks teach us lessons on limiting malware risks at organizations. Learn more from Blink Ops about what these attacks taught us. [...]
title: The Biggest Takeaways from Recent Malware Attacks

description: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security's Cyber Safety Review Board (CSRB) has released a scathing report on how Microsoft handled its 2023 Exchange Online attack, warning that the company needs to do better at securing data and be more truthful about how threat actors stole an Azure signing key. [...]
title: Microsoft still unsure how hackers stole MSA key in 2023 Exchange attack
